resources.string: PharaSnap need access to android accessibility framework to read text on your screen as well as to identify where the text elements are placed on the screen when you tap on them.
Text mode. Tap on the text element to capture
swipe anywhere on screen or tap collapse button to collapse the overlay
Launch widget to copy text on screen
No entries yet! This your last 20 recent item list. When a text is identified it will be shown here

Accessibility services helps app read content on the screen in this case accessibility permission is required to read text on screen and on other apps. On the settings, select this app and enable accessibility permission
When using this tool a floating widget displayed over the screen. Please grant permission to draw over other apps. Don\'t worry you can stop the widget when not in use.

PharaSnap can help you copy text on the screen even on places where you don\'t have the facility directly copy text to clipboard. PharaSnap can even capture text on images without ever leaving the app

To make this tool easily accessible to use add the quick shortcut in your notification panel. Open your notification panel, in the top section (quick settings panel) then tap to customize the panel and add the shortcut tile provided by this app to the active area. Drag and place it on a convenient place \n\nAnother way to open the widget is by long pressing the app launch icon which prompt you open the widget.

When capturing text there are two modes, 
1) Normal mode where you simply tap on text element on screen to capture. 

2) Image mode uses text recognition OCR (for now only support latin characters) to capture text on images. 
When switching to Image mode the app request screen capture in order to visually see the image on the screen. Screen capturing would automatically turn off in 10 seconds after you leave Image mode 

You can toggle between the two modes on left-most button on the widget.

Once you tap on the text on screen (not drag and select) it would get highlighted and you can select multiple selections at once. You can optionally change the text selection which copied.\nYou can also view your last copied items in the recent list from the floating widget itself.
This is an app developed by single person. If love this app useful I would like to hear your feedback and thoughts.
